Updated for 2026

Investment Opportunities in Argentina

From real estate and agriculture to lithium mining and tech startups — discover what investors are doing in Argentina's evolving economy.

Updated analysis of the Milei reforms, RIGI incentives, and emerging opportunities across six key sectors.

Explore SectorsInvestment Visa

The Milei Economic Reform Context

Since taking office in December 2023, President Javier Milei's government has implemented significant economic reforms affecting the investment landscape:

  • Inflation reduced from 211% (2023) to 117% (2024)
  • Foreign land ownership restrictions revoked (Dec 2023)
  • RIGI program: 25% corporate tax for 30 years
  • Capital controls partially lifted (April 2025)
  • Full capital control elimination planned by end of 2025
What Investors Are Watching

The full impact of Milei's reforms is still unfolding. Key developments to monitor:

  • Q2 2025:Capital control elimination timeline
  • Ongoing:RIGI large investment applications
  • 2025:Provincial tax harmonization efforts
Six Key Sectors

Where Investors Are Focusing

Each sector offers distinct risk-return profiles, regional variations, and regulatory considerations. Explore detailed guides for each opportunity.

Moderate Risk
Real Estate Investment

From Buenos Aires luxury apartments to Mendoza vineyards and Patagonia eco-lodges — Argentine real estate offers dollar-denominated opportunities at fractions of comparable global markets.

Min. Investment
$80,000 USD (residential); $200,000+ (commercial)
Time to Return
5-10 years for capital appreciation; immediate rental yields
Explore opportunities
Variable Risk
Agriculture & Agtech Investment

Argentina is the world's 3rd largest soybean exporter, 2nd largest corn exporter, and a major beef producer — with agtech innovation creating new investment verticals in precision farming and sustainable agriculture.

Min. Investment
$150,000 USD (land lease); $500,000+ (farm operations)
Time to Return
3-7 years for land appreciation; annual income from operations
Explore opportunities
High Risk
Mining & Critical Minerals

Argentina holds the world's 3rd largest lithium reserves, significant copper deposits, and untapped gold and silver resources — making it a strategic destination for critical minerals investment.

Min. Investment
$5+ million (exploration); $200+ million (production)
Time to Return
7-12 years (mine development cycle)
Explore opportunities
Variable Risk
Energy Sector Investment

From Vaca Muerta — the world's second-largest shale formation — to world-class wind resources in Patagonia, Argentina's energy sector is undergoing transformation with major investment opportunities.

Min. Investment
$50,000 (small solar); $500+ million (upstream oil & gas)
Time to Return
5-10 years (infrastructure); 2-5 years (renewables)
Explore opportunities
High Risk
Technology & Startups

Buenos Aires is Latin America's 3rd largest startup ecosystem, with strengths in fintech, SaaS, and AI — offering venture capital and angel investment opportunities at valuations below US/EU markets.

Min. Investment
$10,000 (angel); $100,000+ (seed/VC)
Time to Return
5-10 years (typical VC cycle)
Explore opportunities
Moderate Risk
Tourism & Hospitality Investment

From wine tourism in Mendoza to eco-lodges in Patagonia and urban experiences in Buenos Aires — Argentina's tourism sector offers lifestyle investments with income potential in a post-pandemic recovery.

Min. Investment
$100,000 (small B&B); $500,000+ (boutique hotel)
Time to Return
5-8 years for established operations
Explore opportunities
Government Incentive

RIGI: Large Investment Incentive Regime

Argentina's new program offers significant benefits for investments over $200 million USD in priority sectors.

Key Benefits
  • Corporate Tax Rate25% for 30 years (vs. standard 35%)
  • Tax StabilityProtection from new taxes for 30 years
  • CustomsStreamlined import/export procedures
  • DividendsZero withholding tax on foreign dividends
Eligible Sectors
  • Energy (oil, gas, renewables, mining)
  • Infrastructure & logistics
  • Technology & innovation
  • Forestry & agro-industry
  • Industrial manufacturing
  • Tourism (large projects)

Note: RIGI applications require significant legal and financial structuring. Consult specialized Argentine legal counsel for eligibility assessment.

Residency Pathway

Investment Visa for Argentina

Invest approximately $150,000 USD in real estate, business, or strategic sectors and obtain temporary residency leading to permanent residency and citizenship.
